solution_line_template: First, we find their current point in time be realizing that 4 years is 4 sets of 12 months, meaning at that anniversary they will have been together {anniversary_years}*{months_per_year}=<<{anniversary_years}*{months_per_year}={months_at_4th}>>{months_at_4th} months

Then, we subtract their {months_until_4th} month difference, finding they are at {months_at_4th}-{months_until_4th}=<<{months_at_4th}-{months_until_4th}={current_months}>>{current_months} months into their relationship.
Since 2 years would be {second_anniv_years}*{months_per_year}=<<{second_anniv_years}*{months_per_year}={months_at_2nd}>>{months_at_2nd} months into the relationship.

We take the larger number, {current_months}, and subtract the smaller number, {months_at_2nd} to find the difference in months, meaning it is {current_months}-{months_at_2nd}= <<{current_months}-{months_at_2nd}={months_ago}>>{months_ago} months
